1443485904203653124 [2021-09-30] @the_wilderless 💜 13

↓
1443485905386418178 [2021-09-30] @the_wilderless 💜 8
Which is a very different world from the one the early buddhists lived in, where the world was enchanted and full of gods and spirits and devas and divine meaning and whatnot.
↓
1443485908674748417 [2021-09-30] @the_wilderless 💜 12 🔁 1
So… our relationship to “emptiness” and the way we approach it as modern practitioners has to be… incredibly different. Potentially opposite to the original buddhist conception, in a lot of ways.
↓
1443487177535631364 [2021-09-30] @the_wilderless 💜 9
Very very different flavors and very very different practitioner outcomes between:

A: “this world of gods and devils and men and raw significance coursing through the divinity of everything around us—it is ultimately empty, arising from pleroma, to which it will return”
↓
1443487178881998850 [2021-09-30] @the_wilderless 💜 10
Versus 

B: “this world of exact measurements and graphable social dynamics—of death statistics, actuarial tables, and brain chemicals—it is ultimately empty, founded on nothing, with no firm place to stand.”
↓
1443487180240916482 [2021-09-30] @the_wilderless 💜 9
The first one reads like a path to a type of profound (and sure, terrifying) freedom.

The second one looks like a path further into nihilism, with little more than a hope and a prayer that we can dig back out of it again.

The boundary object is the 'ayy lmao' meme format (Odysseus sailing between Scylla and Charybdis), which Visakanv created in September 2021. The arc shows: (1) Pre-history: years of exploring comedy as sacred, meaning/meaninglessness tensions, and the need for humor in facing absurdity (2019-2021), (2) Catalyst: the viral meme crystallizing these ideas into a remixable format (Sept 2021), (3) Dialectic: hundreds of people adopting and remixing the framework to map their own tensions, (4) Realization: the meme becoming a cultural shorthand for dynamic balance, referenced across diverse contexts from relationships to epistemology to parenting. This is primarily constructive - people use it as a practical tool for navigating real dilemmas rather than arguing about which pole is correct. The framework has demonstrated remarkable staying power (3+ years) and generativity (spawning countless variations).
